item.title: If Volvo Made a Camaro, It'd Look Like This
item.description: Volvo is calling it the "next-generation P1800", a nod to the automaker's iconic coupe from the '60s. We're calling it the KMARO.
item.content:encoded: Volvo is calling it the "next-generation P1800", a nod to the automaker's iconic coupe from the '60s. We're calling it the KMARO.
item.dc:creator: Damon Lavrinc

item.title: New Snowden Leak Reports 'Groundbreaking' NSA Crypto-Cracking
item.description: The latest published leak from NSA whistleblower Edward Snowden lays bare details of the U.S. government's highly classified 2013 intelligence budget, and makes the first reference in any of the Snowden documents to a "groundbreaking" U.S. encryption-breaking effort targeted squarely at secure internet traffic.
item.content:encoded: The latest published leak from NSA whistleblower Edward Snowden lays bare details of the U.S. government's highly classified 2013 intelligence budget, and makes the first reference in any of the Snowden documents to a "groundbreaking" U.S. encryption-breaking effort targeted squarely at secure internet traffic.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Poulsen

item.title: Personalizing Your Moto X Could Make It Very Hard to Sell
item.description: Motorola's new smartphone, the Moto X, has a bevy of customization options. This could make the devices more difficult to sell on the secondary market.
item.content:encoded: Motorola's new smartphone, the Moto X, has a bevy of customization options. This could make the devices more difficult to sell on the secondary market.
item.dc:creator: Kif Leswing

item.title: James Spader Is an Unstoppable Robot Killing Machine (In Avengers)
item.description: When you think "invulnerable evil robot plotting the downfall of humanity," you think James Spader, right? If not, you will soon. Thanks, Marvel Studios.
item.content:encoded: When you think "invulnerable evil robot plotting the downfall of humanity," you think James Spader, right? If not, you will soon. Thanks, Marvel Studios.
item.dc:creator: Graeme McMillan

item.title: Florida Fights to Save a Troubled Lagoon and Its Once-Flourishing Marine Life
item.description: Florida's governor and legislature are finally taking an active interest in the demise of the Indian River Lagoon, which runs for 156 miles along the state's Atlantic coast. The lagoon, once prided for hosting more species of marine life than any other estuary in the U.S., is now better known for its toxic algal blooms and mass animal die-offs.
item.content:encoded: Florida's governor and legislature are finally taking an active interest in the demise of the Indian River Lagoon, which runs for 156 miles along the state's Atlantic coast. The lagoon, once prided for hosting more species of marine life than any other estuary in the U.S., is now better known for its toxic algal blooms and mass animal die-offs.
item.dc:creator: Nadia Drake

item.title: GIF Up Your Facebook Timeline With This Third-Party Workaround
item.description: Facebook hasn't been a very GIF-friendly part of the Web. It's still not. But a third-party Flash workaround lets you incorporate these animated gems into your timeline anyway.
item.content:encoded: Facebook hasn't been a very GIF-friendly part of the Web. It's still not. But a third-party Flash workaround lets you incorporate these animated gems into your timeline anyway.
item.dc:creator: Roberto Baldwin

item.title: MakerBot Digitizer Will Clone All Your Stuff Using a Turntable and Lasers
item.description: The Digitizer is about the size of a portable 45 rpm record player -- with a laser-shooting accessory attached to the back.
item.content:encoded: The Digitizer is about the size of a portable 45 rpm record player -- with a laser-shooting accessory attached to the back.
item.dc:creator: Tim Moynihan

item.title: Inside the Postal Startup That Wants to Stick It to the (Mail) Man
item.description: Instead of carriers taking letters to individual mailboxes, Outbox would pick up the mail, open it, scan it, and make digital copies readable via web or app. The Postal Service isn't pleased.
item.content:encoded: Instead of carriers taking letters to individual mailboxes, Outbox would pick up the mail, open it, scan it, and make digital copies readable via web or app. The Postal Service isn't pleased.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Wohlsen

item.title: Tech Companies and Government May Soon Go to War Over Surveillance
item.description: A standoff is looming between technology companies like Apple, Facebook, and Google and government even though much of the focus until now has portrayed the two as being in the same camp.
item.content:encoded: A standoff is looming between technology companies like Apple, Facebook, and Google and government even though much of the focus until now has portrayed the two as being in the same camp.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Gray

item.title: Use These Facebook Privacy Settings to Eradicate Over-Sharing
item.description: Facebook wants you to share as much information about yourself as possible. It wants your friends to do the same. After all, the more personal details you feed into the network, the less likely you are to pack your data suitcase and leave. Advertisers tend to like all that data too. All this means your default privacy settings probably don't jibe with how you want to actually share your information. Luckily, you're not defenseless. With a few small setting adjustments, you can take back control and make sure you share only what you want with the world.
item.content:encoded: Facebook wants you to share as much information about yourself as possible. It wants your friends to do the same. After all, the more personal details you feed into the network, the less likely you are to pack your data suitcase and leave. Advertisers tend to like all that data too. All this means your default privacy settings probably don't jibe with how you want to actually share your information. Luckily, you're not defenseless. With a few small setting adjustments, you can take back control and make sure you share only what you want with the world.
item.dc:creator: Christina Bonnington

item.title: The Best Traffic App Out There Gets an Overhaul, Big Price Cut
item.description: In a serendipitous turn of events, INRIX has released its thoroughly upgraded traffic app just in time for Labor Day, the start of the school year, and the five-day Bay Area headache soon to be known as the Bridgepocalpse.
item.content:encoded: In a serendipitous turn of events, INRIX has released its thoroughly upgraded traffic app just in time for Labor Day, the start of the school year, and the five-day Bay Area headache soon to be known as the Bridgepocalpse.
item.dc:creator: Damon Lavrinc

item.title: 4 Design Lessons From Mynd, a Slick New Calendar App and Virtual Assistant
item.description: Mynd transforms a mess of daily data into actionable information. Here's how.
item.content:encoded: Mynd transforms a mess of daily data into actionable information. Here's how.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Flaherty

item.title: What If We Grew Our Shoes Instead of Making Them?
item.description: Called Natural Selection, the collection was inspired by advances in synthetic biology and 3-D printing technology.
item.content:encoded: Called Natural Selection, the collection was inspired by advances in synthetic biology and 3-D printing technology.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Flaherty

item.title: These Funky Microbes Make Your Favorite Foods More Delicious
item.description: In this gallery several scientists helped us explore the biology of some of the microbes that make our food and drink more delicious. Isn't it time you got to know them a little better?
item.content:encoded: In this gallery several scientists helped us explore the biology of some of the microbes that make our food and drink more delicious. Isn't it time you got to know them a little better?
item.dc:creator: Greg Miller

item.title: Oxford Adds 'Twerking' to Online Dictionaries (Plus 'Bitcoin,' 'Srsly,' and 'Derp')
item.description: Oxford Dictionaries has just announced that it's now including "twerk" in its online version. That was fun while it lasted.
item.content:encoded: Oxford Dictionaries has just announced that it's now including "twerk" in its online version. That was fun while it lasted.
item.dc:creator: Angela Watercutter

item.title: Not Such a Bright Idea
item.description: Welcome to another exciting episode of "You've Got to be Kidding." Today's star attraction is the BlueBulb, an ordinary-looking LED light bulb whose distinguishing feature is its Bluetooth connectivity.
item.content:encoded: Welcome to another exciting episode of "You've Got to be Kidding." Today's star attraction is the BlueBulb, an ordinary-looking LED light bulb whose distinguishing feature is its Bluetooth connectivity.
item.dc:creator: Michael S. Lasky

item.title: Angry Nerd: Cosplay Vigilantes Are Not Real Superheroes
item.description: [HTML1] Thanks to films like Kick-Ass, and now, Kick-Ass 2, cosplay vigilantes have become the new superheroes?in Hollywood's bizarro world! Angry Nerd explains why these everyday crusaders don't cut it.
item.content:encoded: [HTML1] Thanks to films like Kick-Ass, and now, Kick-Ass 2, cosplay vigilantes have become the new superheroes?in Hollywood's bizarro world! Angry Nerd explains why these everyday crusaders don't cut it.
item.dc:creator: WIRED Video

item.title: Man Crosses Twitter and Google Reader to Create Open Source Love Child
item.description: Michael Powers wants to do what so many others have failed to do: build an online social network that's outside the grip of any one company -- and that people like you will actually use.
item.content:encoded: Michael Powers wants to do what so many others have failed to do: build an online social network that's outside the grip of any one company -- and that people like you will actually use.
item.dc:creator: Klint Finley

item.title: Amazon Infiltrates the Android Game Market to Sell You Stuff While You Play
item.description: You've gotten used to paying real cash for hats in Team Fortress 2. What if those purchases came with an actual hat, delivered to your mailbox via Amazon?
item.content:encoded: You've gotten used to paying real cash for hats in Team Fortress 2. What if those purchases came with an actual hat, delivered to your mailbox via Amazon?
item.dc:creator: Ryan Rigney

item.title: Working Tall: The Ultimate Standing Desk Setup
item.description: A great way to boost your health is to stand up -- and move -- while working.
item.content:encoded: A great way to boost your health is to stand up -- and move -- while working.
item.dc:creator: Mark Lukach

item.title: NASA Fires Up Rocket Engine Made of 3-D Printed Parts
item.description: NASA hot-fired a rocket engine using an injector fabricated from layers of a nickel-chromium alloy powder. That's cool. What's cooler? They used 3-D printing to create it.
item.content:encoded: NASA hot-fired a rocket engine using an injector fabricated from layers of a nickel-chromium alloy powder. That's cool. What's cooler? They used 3-D printing to create it.
item.dc:creator: Jason Paur

item.title: Nintendo's Weird New 2DS Proves It: Price Is Always the Problem
item.description: Nintendo's feature-reduced, "entry-level" 2DS system illustrates that lowering the barrier to entry is the key issue for the game console maker.
item.content:encoded: Nintendo's feature-reduced, "entry-level" 2DS system illustrates that lowering the barrier to entry is the key issue for the game console maker.
item.dc:creator: Chris Kohler

item.title: Download These Apps for an All-American, Blue-Blooded Labor Day
item.description: Nothing compliments a good yacht waxing like a finely curated collection of smartphone apps.
item.content:encoded: Nothing compliments a good yacht waxing like a finely curated collection of smartphone apps.
item.dc:creator: Christina Bonnington

item.title: Inspired by a Landmark MLK Comic Book, Civil Rights Icon Makes a Comic of His Own
item.description: The 1958 comic Martin Luther King and the Montgomery Story helped inspire Congressman John Lewis to join the civil rights movement. Now he's making a graphic novel of his own about the March on Washington.
item.content:encoded: The 1958 comic Martin Luther King and the Montgomery Story helped inspire Congressman John Lewis to join the civil rights movement. Now he's making a graphic novel of his own about the March on Washington.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Colter

item.title: Continent on Fire: Map Shows 6 Months of Wildfires Burning North America
item.description: All the major wildfires that have hit the bulk of North America over the last 6 months make for a strikingly full picture when put together. This new map from NOAA shows each fire detected by satellites so far this season.
item.content:encoded: All the major wildfires that have hit the bulk of North America over the last 6 months make for a strikingly full picture when put together. This new map from NOAA shows each fire detected by satellites so far this season.
item.dc:creator: Betsy Mason
